actr.env
Class Frame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      actr.env.Frame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class Frame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

The class that defines a graphical frame (window) for editing and running an ACT-R model. The frame contains a text editor for the model text, a task panel for displaying the task interface, and an output panel for displaying the text output of the simulation.

Author:
Dario Salvucci
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getFile

public java.io.File getFile()
Gets the file associated with the frame.

Returns:
the file, or null if there is none (e.g., the editor has not been saved)

open

public void open(java.io.File file,
                 boolean suppressStyling)
Opens the given file in the frame.

Parameters:
file - the file
suppressStyling - true to disable coloring and indenting (for batch processing)

open

public void open(java.io.File file)
Opens the given file in the frame.

Parameters:
file - the file

open

public void open(java.net.URL url)
Opens the given URL in the frame.

Parameters:
url - the URL

run

public void run()
Runs the model currently loaded into the editor.

run

public void run(boolean reset)
Runs the model currently loaded into the editor, possibly resetting it before running.

Parameters:
reset - flag indicating whether or not to recompile the model before running

runAnalysis

public void runAnalysis()
Runs an analysis of the current model. The analysis runs the model the number of times defined by the task's analysisIterations() method and then runs the task's analyze() method on all the iterations of the task, printing the analysis output to the frame's output panel.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the model simulation at the earliest time possible.

resume

public void resume()
Resumes the previous model simulation if possible (equivalent to run(false)).

output

public void output(java.lang.String s)
Prints the given string to the frame's output panel.

Parameters:
s - the string

clearOutput

public void clearOutput()
Clears the frame's output panel.

outputBuffers

public void outputBuffers()
Prints the current contents of the model buffers.

outputWhyNot

public void outputWhyNot()
Prints the model's current "why not" trace.

public void outputDeclarative()
Prints the model's current declarative memory.

outputProcedural

public void outputProcedural()
Prints the model's current production rules.

outputVisualObjects

public void outputVisualObjects()
Prints the model's current visual objects.

Prints all implemented task classes.

Repaints the simulated brain.
